alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Franklin and northeastern St. Lawrence Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parishville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moira, Bombay, St. Regis, Helena, Brushton, Lawrenceville, Brasher Falls, Hopkinton, Fort Covington Center, South Bombay, Brasher Center, Hogansburg, Westville Center, Ironton, North Lawrence, Converse, Nicholville, Stockholm Center, Winthrop, and Buckton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
